Name: Black Chilli
t1b: Has a very spicy taste.
t2b: Creates a rare spice, that sells for 50g.

Name: Wild Rose
t1b: Intrinsically beautiful.
Flavour: Sometimes a flower is just a flower.

Name: Medical Leaves
t1b: Stabilizes an unconscious creature.
t2b: Creates a healing potion.

Name: Berry
t1b: Regain 1 hp.

Name: Fast-growing Ivy
t1b: Can be shaped into a hat.
t2b: Can be shaped into basic clothing.

Name: Carrot
t1b: Acts as daily ration of food.
t2b: A makeshift whistle.

Name: Sturdy Vine
t1b: Acts as 10 ft of rope.

Name: Crystal Flower
t1b: Your first roll after collecting this petal, has an additional +1 modifier.
Flavour: Life from stone should not exist. And yet...

Name: Gas-filled Pumpkin
t1b: Your voice becomes high-pitched (10 min.).
t2b: To attune a vial of this gas, it must be carried by a person for 1 day. Whoever inhales this gas, gets the voice of the attuned person (10 min.)

Name: White Lotus
t1b: A recognizing sign of a political or criminal organization (at DM's discretion).
t2b: The stem of this flower can be dried and sharpened into a small dagger.

Name: Shaking Chestnuts
t1b: Cures common cold.
t2b: An alchemistic ingredient that sells for 1g.

Name: Dry Tumbleweed
t1b: Each creature in the 60 ft. line must make a DC 12 Dex saving throw. A creature takes 2d6+3 fire damage on a failed save. Flammable targets ignite.
Event: A tumbleweed rolls past you. You may catch it with a DC 12 Dexterity skill check.

Name: Corpse Flower
t1b: Emits a subtle smell that can be tracked by dogs or trained trackers in a 10 mile radius (3 days).
t2b: Creates a rare spice, that sells for 50g.

Name: Bell Bush
t1b: Ten flowers that can be planted in an area. Stepping on them makes a loud sound (DC 14 Dexterity saving throw).
t2b: A bag of seeds that makes a loud noise when thrown, all creatures in 10 ft radius go deaf for 15 seconds.

Name: Animal Nip
t1b: +2 to animal handling (1 day).
t2b: The beast understands your verbal commands, but is not forced to follow them.

Name: Copycat Fertilizer
t1b: After a day this fertilizer transforms into any other plant. It must be used on the same day or it decays into nothing.
Flavour: Hope you don't mind the smell.

Name: Tea Leaves
t1b: Roll d4. On 4, recover one step of exhaustion. On 3, recover 5 hp. On 2, remember a childhood memory. On 1, fall asleep.

Name: Goodberry Bush
t1b: The branch can repeatedly expand into a bush or contract back to a branch on command. If hidden inside, +3 to stealth.
t2b: After a week, you can collect 1 goodberry (see Druid) per day. Bush lasts for 1 month.

Name: Four-leaf clover
t1b: After any roll, but before you know if it succeeds or fails, squish the four-leaf clover to add +1 to the result.

Name: Oily shrubbery
t1b: Cannot be grappled (1 hour).
t2b: Cannot be disarmed (1 hour).

Name: Dandelion Light
t1b: You float 5 feet above the surface. Your moving speed otherwise remains the same. (1 hour)
t2b: The Dandelion light raises high into the air and emits yellow light like a flare. (10 minutes)

Name: Spotted Mushroom
t1b: Roll DC 12 Constitution. On success become inspired by the dish, and get advantage on the first roll you make in the next 30 minutes. On failure you have heavy digestion problems for the next 12 hours.

Name: 10 Feet Branch
t1b: Can be used as a 10 feet pole.
Flavour: An elegant weapon for a more civilized age.

Name: Good-Luck Lily Pad
t1b: When carried, it gives +1 to nature skill.
t2b: When doused with a special substance, enlarges into a boat that can carry one creature (medium or smaller). Loses previous benefit.

Name: Thorned Nectar
t1b: DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or become aggressive against all targets. Lose any social restraint. (1 min)
t2b: When peeling receive 1d4 damage. All who inhale (10 feet radius) get Calm emotion cast on them.

Name: Nightshade
t1b: The next long rest can be 4 hour shorter.
t2b: In addition to the previous effect, gain darkvision for 4 hours.

Name: Homeopathic Mold
t1b: For the next day, become immune to poison.
t2a: Name a specific poison. Consume all charges.
t2b: Roll a DC 15 Con saving throw, on success become permanently immune to the named poison. Else become poisoned by it.

Name: Amortentia
t1b: +1 persuasion when talking to a creature attracted to your sex (1 hour).
t2a: Mixed with a hair. Potion. Consumed.
t2b: +5 to persuasion when talking to the person who owned the hair strand. (1 day)

Name: Tentacle Weed
t1b: Counts as a simple weapon that only the herbalist is proficient with.
t2b: DC 6 Dexterity to eat. If successful, you can breath underwater for 1 hour, else take 1d4 damage.

Name: Spreading Roots
t1b: Get +1 strength (1 hour).
t2b: Cast Spike growth spell.

Name: Living Ice Crystal
t1b: Emits dim light.
t2b: Emits bright light. Can be sold for 100g to collectors.

Name: Poison Leaves
t1b: DC 10 Constitution saving throw or inflicts poisonous condition that lasts for 1 hour.
t2b: Liquid with DC 15 Constitution saving throw or inflicts poisonous condition for X hours and Xd8 damage.

Name: Once-in-the-lifetime Pumpkin
t1b: On 18+ the pumpkin becomes a carriage, else it can be used as 10 food rations.

Name: Truffles
t1b: Gain 1d4 hp.
t2b: Create a dish that heals for 4d4 hp.

Name: Ghost Melon
t1b: +1 to hit and +1 damage to undead (24h).
t2b: You can see all undead in 60 ft. radius, even through walls. Make a Wisdom skill check, on 12 or lower, all undead in 60 ft. radius see you.

Name: Lightning Flower
t1a: Used as a spell casting component.
t1b: If the spell deals thunder/lightning damage, roll two additional dice of the same type.
t2b: Each 6 seconds, for 1 minute, a lightning hits the flower (if possible), dealing 1d12 to all creatures in 5 ft radius.
Event: As you touch the flower, a lightning bolt strikes you from the clear sky. DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d12 thunder damage.

Name: Pale-blue Flower
t1b: Naturally cold weather has no effect on you (1 day).
t2b: Resistance to cold damage (1 hour).
Event: When you tear the flower from its stem, your arm freezes and cannot be moved for 30 minutes.

Name: Salamander Flower
t1b: Your next 5 hits with the weapon deal an additional 1d4 fire damage.
t2b: The fire expands in size 3 fold in all directions. All touched by this fire receive 3d12 fire damage.
Event: As you approach the flower, a ring of fire erupts all around it, 10 feet in diameter. Touching it causes 1d8 fire damage.

Name: Half-White, Half-Black Flower
t1b: The next time you deal radiant damage increase it by d12. The next time you receive necrotic damage, reduce it by d12 (1 day).
t2b: The next time you deal necrotic damage increase it by d12. The next time you receive radiant damage, reduce it by d12 (1 day).

Name: Power-infused Thistle
t1b: Recovers one expanded level 1 spell slot.
t2b: Recovers one expanded level 3 spell slot.

Name: Harmonica Fruit
t1b: Casts Misty step.
t2b: Casts Gaseous form.

Name: Cryptic beans
t1b: Contains 5 beans in a pod. All who consume 1 bean can talk telepathically for 1 hour.

Name: Oak bark
t1b: A shield, + 3 AC.
t2b: A medium armor, AC 15 + Dex (max 2).

Name: Invasive Plant
t1b: If planted far from its native region, can quickly spread and if not controlled, overwhelm the local ecosystem.
t2b: Cast Entangle spell (3 charges).

Name: Tree of Paradise
t1b: In an hour after being planted, it grows 100 feet in height. After a month bears very rare fruits that can be sold for 1000g to certain collectors. The height and colors of the tree attracts (unwanted) attention of all sort of individuals.

Name: Hallucinogenic Mushroom
t1b: Your vision blurs. DC 10 Constitution saving throw or disadvantage on all rolls. Dispels on any damage taken. (1 hour)
t2b: Halucination begins. On DC 18 Wisdom, cast Commune spell. All other rolls automatically fail. Dispels on any damage taken. (1 hour)

Name: Soothing Petals
t1b: +4 against intimidation and fear effects (10 minutes).
t2b: DC 14 Constitution or the target immediately falls asleep (6 hours). Dispels on any damage taken.

Name: Euphoric Grapes
t1b: +8 to Charisma when doing public speeches (1 minute).
t2b: You have 3 d12 inspiration dice that you can use on any throw made by you or your allies (1 day).

Name: Night Tulip
t1b: Removes one point of exhaustion.
t2a: Alchemy kit (3 days). Inhaled (10 ft range)
t2b: Attempt a Constitution saving throw. On less than 18, fall asleep, on less than 14 forget all events of the past hour.

Name: Head in the Clouds
t1b: Gain Flying. Roll (Int) with an extra -5 modifier, then your Int stat becomes the result of the roll. Repeat for Wisdom and Charisma. (10 minutes)

Name: Strawman Bush
t1b: Repels away (30 ft) all wild beasts of CR 3 or less.
t2b: Strawman awakens into a friendly NPC with the Guard stat block. It obeys all verbal commands. After 1 day it becomes a plant again.

Name: Guardians
t1b: Each contains a 200g gem inside them.
t2b: They can help you with directions and lore of the current area.
Event: When you try cutting a branch, the tree starts to move. You become surrounded by 2 Treants, that use their first action to awake 1 tree each (see Monster manual). They are aggressive towards you, claiming you are destroying the forest. You may flee, fight or negotiate.

Name: Tear of a Goddess
t1b: Cures blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or petrified.
t2b: You gain Supreme healing potion.

Name: Charcoal-Black Plant
t1b: Cures any poison.
t2a: Combined with Tear of the goddess.
t2b: You gain Supreme healing potion.

Name: Tree of the Living Death
t1b: You appear dead to all outward inspection and to spells used to determine your status. You are blinded and incapacitated. (6 hours)
t2b: Potion. After exactly 6 hours, if the creature that consumed this potion has 100 hp or fewer, it dies with no discernible signs.

Name: Fevered Dream
t1b: If willing, transform into a random beast for 10 minutes (DM chooses).
t2b: All creatures in 30 ft radius that inhale the smoke make DC 15 Wis saving throw or transform into random beasts (10 min).

Name: Blood Algae
t1b: +3 to hit and +3 to damage against demons and devils (1 hour).
t2a: Draw ritualistic signs on the floor
t2b: Make an Int skill check. On 12 or more a random hostile demon appears. On 18 or more it obeys your orders for a day.

Name: Scrying Beans
t1b: Get 3 divination dice for the rest of the day (look up Divination wizard - Portent).
t2b: Cast Scrying spell.

Name: Assimilation Plant
t1b: Your skin hardens and thorns cover your body. Choose two effects from the list: +3 AC, +7 stealth in forest areas, +2 damage on melee attacks, melee attackers get hit for 1d6 when they hit you, advantage on concentration checks, +2 strength. (1 hour)

Name: Neck Breaker
t1b: Wherever the plant is currently planted it emits the Hallucinatory Terrain effect centered around it (of the herbalist choice). The plant can be moved and replanted at a different place.
Event: The Neck Breaker Plant grows out of a thin peak, surrounded by a 100 feet deep and 30 feet wide pit. The pit is invisible and appears as solid terrain. When this card is drawn make DC 18 Perception check or start falling in the pit.

Name: Immortal Lily
t1b: If unconscious on your turn, instead of death-saving throws, regain 1 hp (1 day).
t2b: You do not age for the next 25 years.
Event: You encounter a CR 17+ dragon (at DM discretion) that is not aggressive, but would defend the lily with its life.

Name: Bond Breaker
t1b: You are spiritually free of earthly bonds. You gain flying speed of 60 feet and cannot be charmed or frightened. You get +3 to Wisdom.
Event: To get the effect you must meditate under the tree. Roll d4. On 4 forget all your childhood memories, on 3 lose interest in any earthly possessions, on 2 abandon your life ambitions, on 1 you will never again feel happiness or sadness.

Name: Symbiotic Death
t1b: Your skin gets a slightly greenish hue. Once per turn, if a creature touches your bare skin, you may have it take Xd4+2 poison damage.
Event: An old inscription dares you to eat as many petals as you can in order to get an ancient power. Choose a number X and eat X petals. Take Xd12 + 3 damage. If this damage would make you unconscious, it kills you instead.

Name: Oceans Test
t1b: The sea considers you worthy. You gain swimming speed of 120 feet and can breath underwater. Most sea creatures (DM discretion) are friendly to you and can understand your verbal commands.
Event: A plant grows at the bottom of a 3000 ft. deep underwater fissure and is guarded at DM discretion. Your worthiness is proved by pulling it out of the rock (Strength check, DC 18).

Name: Thiefs Dream
t1b: Wood and stone obstacles that are up to 10 ft. thick appear transparent to you. You may freely walk through them, as long as you end your turn outside.
Event: You have tracked the general location of this plant, but it grows in the middle of a rock, with no visible outwards signs. Choose a spot (Wisdom skill check). A mining team (or similar) can excavate this spot in one day. If the result of the roll was 20 or higher, find the plant. Can be repeated each day.

Name: Giant Scales
t1b: You gain +2 to Strength, +2 to Constitution and +3 to all thunder damage dealt.
t2b: You gain +10 to movement speed, cannot be paralyzed or petrified and +3 to all thunder damage dealt.
Event: A pair of Storm Giants roam the area. On their backs grow rare scales that are rumored to be the source of their power. The path to their lair is marked with skulls of adventurers who tried to take them.

Name: Sturdy Undergrowth
t1b: Restore 1d4 hp when eaten.
t2b: An elementary snare for small animals.

Name: Snow Seeds
t1b: The first time you would be surprised in combat, negate the 'surprised' status and consume this plant (24h).
t2b: You may release this plant to summon a snowstorm that reduces visibility of all creatures in 30 ft. radius to 10 ft. (1 min).
Event: They pass by you, almost indistinguishable from snowflakes. Can only be captured by the most perceptive (DC 20 Perception).

Name: Ancient Root
t1b: Continually whispers secrets in a language no one understands.
t2b: A potion that can be used to gain 2d6 temporary hit points for 10 minutes.

Name: Warmth-Seeker
t1b: This flower always grows turned to the nearest fire, regardless of its distance. No effect after being collected.
Flavour: It doesn't point north, but you are not trying to find north.

Name: Enchanted Branch
t1b: Acts as a thrown dagger, dealing 2d4 cold damage on hit.
t2b: Acts as a sword dealing 3d6 cold damage on hit. Shatters on first miss, dealing 1d4 cold damage to the wielder.

Name: Red on White
t1b: For the next 24h you can only step on snow or fall unconscious (1 hour) failing to do so. You do not leave tracks, have +10 stealth, and any melee attacks against surprised creatures are automatically critical hits.
Flavour: It requires both blood and snow to grow. Fortunately, its life cycle provides both.
Event: When attempting to collect the thorny flower, make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw and take 3d12 damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Name: Mirror Moss
t1b: Your hand can cross the moss into its own pocket dimension. You may place a non-magical object (or up to 100 gold) into it. A day later you may retrieve two copies out it. The moss is destroyed in the process.
Event: The moss reflects your image. After a few seconds the image emerges with the player's exact stats, hostile, and controlled by the DM. It returns to moss if not defeated.

Name: Eternal Blizzard
t1b: The snowstorm stops. You become immune to cold damage.  Whenever you are attacked by a non-magical source while standing in the snow, you may use your reaction to evade it. When doing so, your body melts into the snow and re-appears from snow in an un-occupied spot in 10 ft radius.
Event: There is a 1 sq. mile region always covered in snowstorms. Any creature within it gets visibility reduced to 5 ft and takes 1d4 damage at the end of each of their turns. Any spot within is equally likely as the plant location. There may be monsters hiding in the storm (at DM discretion).

Name: Parasite Mushroom
t1b: At the end of each day make a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw and get 3 points of exhaustion on failure.
t2b: Until removed, all other Wisdom saving throws automatically succeed. Previous effect still applies.

Name: Firewood
t1b: Ignites easily, burns for a long time.

Name: Cached Nuts
t1b: Serves as one food ration.
Flavour: A feast for some. Famine for others.

Name: Dark Leaves
t1b: Bitter taste, but can be chewed for hours.

Name: Exploding Pinecones
t1b: Throw an additional d4 when making the ranged attack. On 4, pinecone deals 2d4+2 damage on hit, and ignites the target. On 3, it deals 1d4+1 on hit. On 2, deals 1 damage. On 1, it explodes in your hand, dealing you 1d4 damage.

Name: Northern Evergreen
t1b: Your hair and facial hair grow with five times their natural speed.
t2b: A potion widely regarded as a cure for baldness that can be sold for up to 5g. The alchemy guild classifies it as a scam.

Name: Snow-White Blossom
t1b: The next time you would fail an Int or Wis saving throw you succeed instead (6h).
t2a: Applied on skin immediately after collecting.
t2b: The next time you would fail a Str or Con saving throw you succeed instead (6h).

Name: Barrel Cactus
t1b: Full of drinkable juice.
Flavour: Some say it rolls towards water when no one is watching.

Name: Scorching Grass
t1b: A large patch of dry grass, hot to the touch.
t2b: +1 stealth when in the same biome.

Name: Desert Jasmine
t1b: You smell nice until the end of the day.

Name: Needler
t1a: Stick its spikes into the ground.
t1b: Any creature that steps on them (5 ft. area) takes 1 piercing damage.
t2b: Over the next four hours all sunburns and heat exhaustion fade away. You take 1 piercing damage whenever you make a step.

Name: Hard-shelled Beans
t1b: Roll Const. DC 15. On success, acts as one food ration. On failure, take 1d4 damage.
t2b: Softens and can be used as three food rations.

Name: Pheromoner
t1b: Its smell attracts a constant swarm of insects.
t2b: Its smell repels insects in a 15 ft. radius.

Name: Unidentifiable Scrub
t1b: Roll Nature: On 18+, recover 1d6d hp, on 14+ you enjoy a delicious and unique tea. On 6 or less, it’s a poison that covers you in rashes.
Flavour: Its really hard to guess which it is.

Name: Stump Canal
t1b: Forms a forking underground tube with multiple tree-stump-like visible ends in a 50 miles area. Any sound made at one end, transfers perfectly to all other ends.
Flavour: We do not know who else may be listening.

Name: False Hope
t1a: Bury an item belonging to a dead creature.
t1b: A ghost of that creature appears and you may have a 30-minute conversation with it. The next time you fall unconscious, start with two failed death-saving throws.
Flavour: Those who seek the company of the dead, often unexpectedly find it.
Event: On a night with the full moon this plant will start blooming, and the domain of the living and the dead will intertwine around it. You may return to this location then.

Name: Date of Love
t1b: Two dates grow on a tree. If two creatures willingly eat one each, they will not find anyone else attractive until the same date next year. Can be sold.

Name: Baobab Tower
t1b: The roots of this tree form a map of the local area.
t2b: The upper part of the tree is hollow and can be carved into a lookout tower, fitting 5 medium creatures.
Event: The air in the area around the tree is distorted so that it looks much closer than it really is. If you try to reach it, walk 4 hours towards it. Roll Survival, DC 10: on failure the tree is an illusion, on success, you find it, but forget the way back.

Name: Blood in the Wind
t1a: Collect a piece of the bark.
t1b: You may use it to cast “Control winds” spell once.
t2a: Follow the tunnel at its roots.
t2b: Leads to a secret location at DMs discretion.
Event: The tree is surrounded by a constant spiraling wind, carrying razor sharp leaves. If you approach it, throw Dex. DC 18. On success you reach the trunk, on failure take 1d4 damage and repeat the throw (until you succeed or fall unconscious).

Name: Shadow Peyote
t1b: Share a pipe with this leaf in a social gathering with the locals. Roll Con. DC 12: On success you earn their respect, on failure fall asleep.
Flavour: Now you are one of us.

Name: The Forbidden Fruit
t1b: Gain +4 to Int. until the end of the day. If you fail an Int. check or saving throw during this time, this bonus becomes -4, and lasts one week, instead.
Flavour: Only the wise know how much they do not know.

Name: Desert Siren
t1b: You ignore penalties for difficult terrain when walking on sand and are unaffected by the sun’s heat.
t2a: Alchemy kit. 500g materials. refine into oil.
t2b: When this oil is applied to a melee weapon, its next three attacks melt opponent’s armor, reducing their AC by 1 each hit.
Event: An irresistible song lures you towards the plant, and you soon find yourself trapped in the quicksand, and slowly start sinking in. Quicksand surrounds 30 ft. area around the plant.

Name: Vanisher
t1a: Spores used as a spellcasting component.
t1b: The spell is invisible until it reaches the target.
t2a: Spores added when forging a weapon.
t2b: The weapon becomes permanently invisible.
Event: Collecting the spores requires massive manual dexterity. Roll Slight of hand, DC 18. On failure, the spores fall on you and you become invisible, unable to speak, cast spells or attack for 24 hours. Discard this plant.

Name: Last Stand
t1b: All sleeping creatures in 15 ft. radius get instantly awake and can’t get back to sleep for the next 4 hours.
t2b: Regain all hit points. Gain 30 movement speed and advantage on all attacks. At the end of every turn gain a point of exhaustion. (6 turns)

Name: Burning Temptation
t1b: The tale of this trial becomes widespread and many start considering you a spiritual leader. You may cast the following spells at will (3 times/day): Skywrite, Charm person, Command, Calm Emotions and Fear.
Event: You must remain seated uninterrupted for six days. Every day the plant tempts you to move: by offering you food (Str, DC 5), water (Con, DC 8), inflicting thorny pain (Dex, DC 11), telling lies (Int, DC 14), false promises (Cha, DC 17) and offering real riches (Wis, DC 20).

Name: Tall Palm
t1b: Roll Dex. DC 12. If you succeed, you reach the top of the palm and get a vantage point view of the surroundings.

Name: Rainbane
t1b: An ancient ritual for chasing rain away.
Flavour: Its effect has yet to be proven.

Name: Coconut
t1b: Acts as one daily ration.
t2b: Make a ranged attack that deals 1d4 damage on hit.

Name: Giant Palm Leaves
t1b: A makeshift umbrella.
t2b: A makeshift shelter.

Name: Acoustic Pitcher
t1b: All sounds in 10 ft. radius are swallowed by this plant. No one can hear them.
t2b: The plant exactly reproduces the last 1 hour of sound captured.

Name: Guttator
t1b: This plant gets wet when it is raining, regardless of any shelter it may have.
Flavour: There is no explanation for this phenomenon. Nor is there any known use.

Name: Lucky Charm
t1b: Pray for the safety of another creature. The next time that creature is attacked, it gets +2 bonus AC (for that attack only).
t2b: If you fall unconscious, your first death-saving throw automatically succeeds. The Lucky Charm vanishes into thin air.

Name: Living Vine
t1b: Can be used as a melee, finesse weapon that deals 1d4 damage. It is strong enough to carry the weight of two medium creatures.
t2b: For the next hour, you can command the whip to wrap around any object or creature it successfully hits.

Name: Lichen Shroud
t1b: Your voice becomes silky smooth for one hour. You get +1 to charisma for the duration.
t2b: You create silky strings that can be sold for 5g.

Name: Traveler
t1b: The recipient must succeed in a Wis. saving throw DC 7, or is commanded to plant the Traveler at least 30 feet away.
t2b: If consumed, advatange on wisdom saving throws for 30 min. If spilled, Traveler grows back from that spot in the next 14 days.
Event: On pick-up, make a Wis. saving throw, DC 7, or you hear a voice in your head commanding you to plant it at least 30 feet away. You must obey (and lose this plant).

Name: Bad Omen
t1b: When you collect this leaf, choose a creature type. If approached by the creature of the named type (500 ft. radius or less), the leaf becomes darker and darker. If that creature enters a 30 ft. radius around you, the leaf crumbles and becomes unusable.
Flavour: Death of the leaf is often followed by the death of the owner.

Name: Phantom Feast
t1b: You stumble into a tropical garden with all sorts of exotic fruits. Any number of creatures may partake in this delicious feast.
t2b: The garden and all its food disappear. All who partook in the feast fall asleep. There may be other consequences at DM’s discretion.

Name: Oddly Specific Tree
t1b: You feel like you walked past this tree before…
t2b: You are completely and utterly lost. Coincidentally, you find an item or location that was lost for centuries (at DMs discretion).

Name: Pocket Paradise
t1b: Enter a blissful state (one hour). After three days, you get disadvantage on every roll until you consume another bite or a week passes.
t2b: The transaction may get attention of local authorities, other consumers, or sellers, at DM’s discretion.

Name: Soulswap
t1b: You now see through their eyes, and vice versa. The effect lasts for 30 minutes or until one of you dies.
t2b: You now feel their physical pain and vice versa. This effect does not affect hit points and lasts for 30 minutes or until one of you dies.

Name: Nightmare Flower
t1b: The first creature to meet your eyes becomes terrified of you and has disadvantage on all attacks against you on its next turn.
t2b: Plagued by nightmares. On your next long rest, make a Wis. DC 17 saving throw. On failure you cannot sleep and take 2d6 psychic damage.
Event: As you approach the flower, you start seeing visions of your deepest fears. Roll Wis. DC 15 saving throw, and start running away in a random direction on failure.

Name: Valley Kraken
t1b: Find equipment belonging to past travelers (at DM discretion).
t2b: You collect 1d6+1 ounces of extremely strong glue. One ounce of the glue can cover a 1-foot square surface.
Event: You see equipment overgrown by an old tree trunk. Roll Nature DC 8. On failure, you approach too closely, and tentacles erupt to ambush you (DMG: Roper). Otherwise, you may find this plant later.

Name: Dead or Alive
t1b: Choose one person you can name, and one of the three questions: are they alive, do they like me, is their name real. Pick petals one by one, and the color of the last remaining one tells you the true answer.
Event: Whisper to the plant a secret that only a few people know. You forget it.

Name: Dragon Coffee
t1b: During this round you have +15 movement speed and an unlimited number of reactions.
t2b: The above effect lasts for 3 days, after which you get 3 points of exhaustion.  During this time you don't need nor benefit from long rests.

Name: Devil Whisperer
t1b: You become blindingly overconfident. Your next X rolls are automatically 20. Lasts for one hour. (X can be 0-10)
Event: When you collect leaves from this plant, you become blindingly overconfident and believe you will succeed in everything you try. Lasts for one hour.

Name: Corrosive Leaves
t1b: Lose all hit points, but one. Gain twice that number of temporary hit points. They last until the end of next round.
t2a: Worn on skin for one month. Permanent.
t2b: You lose 2d6 max hp. After one month you gain natural armor AC 15 when unarmored and resistance to poison and necrotic damage.

Name: Jungle King
t1b: The smoke lures in all kinds of wildlife in a 1-mile radius.
t2b: All beasts with CR 3 or lower obey your commands, as best as they can understand them. Lasts one day.

Name: Heart of the Forest
t1b: For each creature sacrificed this way, you may draw a face on a tree. At any time you can concentrate to see and hear everything one of these faces would sense, regardless of your distance. Whenever you touch a tree with a face, you may teleport to any other such tree. You can control who can see the faces at any time.
Event: You may convince any number of humanoid creatures to be sacrificed on the altar in  the heart of the forest. These creatures must be willing to die, and must not be coerced, magically or otherwise. They cannot be resurrected.

Name: Chamomile
t1b: Makes excellent tea.

Name: Sunflower
t1b: Its seeds can be used to extract a small amount of oil or to feed local birds.

Name: Cobblecap Moss
t1b: You make less noise (+1 to stealth) when walking.
t2b: Your eyes turn yellow. You have no disadvantage on perception checks in dim light (1 hour).

Name: Magpie Nest
t1b: You find d6 bronze coins and d4 silver coins. If you roll 6 and 4 respectively, you also find a piece of jewelry belonging to a local noble.

Name: Willow Bark
t1b: Lessens pain.
t2b: Potion that provides 2d4 temporary hit points for 1 minute.

Name: Moving Nest
t1a: Placed in hair or in fur
t1b: Will grow into a 2 feet tall bush over the next week, sustaining only from the fibers in the hair and skin oils.
Flavour: Most bushes rely on wind to spread their seeds... not this one.

Name: Fertile Fields
t1b: You find produce (salad, potatoes, etc) equivalent to 5 daily rations. Taking it angers the owner if seen.
Event: A farmer is collecting produce from the field. If you find a way to distract him (Persuasion DC 10) and sneak by (Stealth DC 10) you may steal the food.

Name: Marker Moss
t1b: The Marker Moss bruises easily when touched and remains so for its lifetime.
t2b: Your skin marks on touch (1 day).
Flavour: Line marks a house with valuables. Dot for guarded. Cross for already robbed.

Name: Spell Drinker
t1b: Grows from almost any terrain and sticks to any surface when growing. Can be climbed.
t2b: Spell Drinker almost instantly grows 10 ft. for each level of the expended slot. Growth may be accelerated multiple times.

Name: Cleanser
t1b: Fills the space with a pleasant, relaxing aroma.
t2b: Roll a Wisdom check. With 18+, ghosts in the house are banished. With 12+, they appear and attack.

Name: Empyrean Yeast
t1a: Store in a container. add 10g of ingredients.
t1b: Yeast grows for 10 days. After this time you may extract the container into a Potion of Fermentation.
t2a: Drop this potion in any alcoholic beverage.
t2b: After 15 minutes, it doubles the alcoholic content of the beverage (up to 90%), without changing its taste.

Name: Tracker
t1a: Place the petal into a puddle.
t1b: The petal dissolves in the water. One by one, the reflections of every creature that has stepped in the puddle within the last 24 hours appear.

Name: Living Web
t1b: Your hands and feet stick to any surface, allowing you to climb vertical terrain.
t2b: Your mouth is glued closed, and you can’t speak for the next hour.

Name: Curse Bleeder
t1b: You may write any warlock spell (level 2 or lower) on an object. That object acts as a scroll for that spell.
t2b: Deal 3d6 necrotic damage. Both uses of Curse Bleeder shrink the tattoos at the same rate as they appeared.
Event: When the tree is cut, it bleeds an ink-like resin. Each time a creature inflicts a cut, they permanently lose 1 max HP, and sinister, demonic tattoos materialize on their hands. These tattoos expand with every subsequent incision. Each cut grants one additional use of the plant.

Name: Twirling Piper
t1b: Roll a d4. On a 1, you are ambushed by a group of Satyrs. On a 2, you become lost. On a 3, nothing happens. On a 4, you find a chest containing 30 gold coins and a magical scroll of the DM's choosing.
Event: A leaf twirls in the wind, never quite falling to the ground. It's moving back and forth, from you to the nearby forest. You feel inclined to follow it, but may choose not to do so.

Name: Size Changer
t1b: Every time you lose HP, roll a d4: On a 1, your body size becomes Tiny; on a 2, Small; on a 3, Large; and on a 4, Huge. Your stats and hit points remain unaffected.

Name: Sludge Flower
t1b: Your arrows deal an additional d4 poison damage.
t2a: Distill into a potion. Disgusting taste.
t2b: Lose your sense of smell and taste for a week, but gain a +3 bonus on Perception checks related to sight and hearing during this time.
Event: The flower is surrounded by a 60 ft. area filled with an overwhelming smell of decay. If you end your turn within this area, make a Const. saving throw (DC 10). On a failed save, take 2d6 damage. The smell does not dissipate when the flower is collected.

Name: Cinderleaf
t1a: Slowly drag leaves past each other
t1b: This action creates a spark that can ignite a fire and can be used repeatedly.
t2b: This action creates a fireball that deals 6d6 damage to all creatures within a 10-foot radius. The leaves are consumed in the process.
Event: When two cinderleaf tree leaves collide, they ignite and deal 3 damage to everything within a 5 ft. radius. To safely collect a leaf, make a Sleight of Hand check with a DC of 13 or higher. Wind or similar effects increase the DC. You need two leaves.

Name: Blabbeler
t1b: The brewer of the potion must remain silent for the entire 7 day duration of brewing.
t2b: Roll Wis. Saving throw (DC 18). On failure you are unable to stop speaking out every one of your thoughts for the duration (1 hour).

Name: Name Thief
t1b: When two people eat one berry each, they start believing they have the name of the other. All their memories are altered accordingly. Lasts for 24 hours.

Name: Symbiotic Succulents
t1b: As long as you leave the Symbiotic Succulent attached, you have -10 movement speed and +1 to Constitution.
t2b: You feel very light and gain 5 movement speed for each 5 days you were carrying the plant (but not more than 30). Lasts for 24h.
Event: As you step onto what seemed to be a rock, it closes around your foot like a bear trap. The rocky plant is very heavy, but seems to imbue you with power.

Name: Thorny Prison
t1a: Forty roses planted in a 15 ft circle.
t1b: Roses form a magical barrier. Anything can enter it, but nothing can pass out of it. Can be disenchanted or destroyed from outside.
t2b: Cast Wall of Force.
Event: A grave is covered with forty thorny roses and guarded with human NPCs at DM’d discretion. You lose 1 hp, for each rose you pluck out. When the last one is uprooted, a CR 13 hostile Vampire crawls out the grave (see Monster Manual).

Name: The Hanging Tree
t1b: You wake up, winning the allegiance of the spirits.
t2b: Any number of spirits you previously defeated come to help you in one encounter. Each spirit may only be summoned once.
Event: You may choose to hang yourself on the world's oldest hanging tree. If you do, the DM selects a sequence of progressively stronger humanoids who died there. You must battle their spirits one by one in your mind, using your own and their real stat blocks. You may wake up after any fight, but if you continue and lose, you die and cannot be resurrected.

Name: Facade
t1b: Placeholder
t2b: Placeholder
